posts.post_content: He may ignore Death, but he can't ignore Infect.
posts.html:
He may ignore Death, but he can't ignore Infect.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: NecroticNobody (9/23/2010 7:10:25 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
This. lady's and gentlemen, is the honest to goodness flagship Mythic of the set. This is what should be by the definition of a Mythic Rare. It represents the set, leaves an impression, but isn't necessary for tournament play and it isn't an automatic inclusion in decks.  
  
It also tag teams nicely with Platinum Angel. She's one of the few forces that can stop poison counters from killing you, but lets you drop to negative life. This big o'le loveable guy braces you against the most savage facebeatings so you can still live if someone nixes him, but he's hopeless against Infect in general. The Platinums make a cute couple. :P
posts.html:
This. lady's and gentlemen, is the honest to goodness flagship Mythic of the set. This is what should be by the definition of a Mythic Rare. It represents the set, leaves an impression, but isn't necessary for tournament play and it isn't an automatic inclusion in decks.

It also tag teams nicely with Platinum Angel. She's one of the few forces that can stop poison counters from killing you, but lets you drop to negative life. This big o'le loveable guy braces you against the most savage facebeatings so you can still live if someone nixes him, but he's hopeless against Infect in general. The Platinums make a cute couple. :P

posts.post_content:
@ Audhi5000: Read the *reminder text*: ''You can't pay any amount of life, except 0.'' ;)  
  
Anyway: Awesome card, all I can say. Well, I can of course say that it has the 'weakness' that it can be destroyed. But that's -AS ALWAYS- a weak argument. Once again I shall have to explain: Compare it to other creatures. It's about *the time it **isn't** destroyed.* Yes, it is unfortunate if your opponent destroys it... But as long as you still have it, it is BADASS.

Posted By: eTHERIUMoFmASTER (2/3/2011 6:55:15 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Wormfang  
Not to burst your bubble, but placing quiet disrepair on him would simply allow you to destroy him during your upkeep. Since your life total can't change, you'll simply stay at your current life total.  
  
As for cost for cards relevant to power and toughness/effects, an 8/8 for 8 colorless is already pretty awesome, his effect's really useful if you have a [method](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=233298) of dealing with poison counters. Not that that's always relevant. Destruction is unfortunate, but it's the reason they have so many cards, like [turn aside](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=turn aside) and [withstand death](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=withstand death) to help save him. heck, you could use [not of this world](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=not of this world). But i digress... the main point was to note that it's generally the x/x for x>1 colorless creatures without drawbacks that make some savage creatures.   
  
See: Cathodion, Su-chi, Wurmcoil Engine, and Darksteel Colossus
posts.html:
@Wormfang
Not to burst your bubble, but placing quiet disrepair on him would simply allow you to destroy him during your upkeep. Since your life total can't change, you'll simply stay at your current life total.

As for cost for cards relevant to power and toughness/effects, an 8/8 for 8 colorless is already pretty awesome, his effect's really useful if you have a method of dealing with poison counters. Not that that's always relevant. Destruction is unfortunate, but it's the reason they have so many cards, like turn aside and withstand death to help save him. heck, you could use not of this world. But i digress... the main point was to note that it's generally the x/x for x>1 colorless creatures without drawbacks that make some savage creatures.

See: Cathodion, Su-chi, Wurmcoil Engine, and Darksteel Colossus
